description: Numbers n such that every base 8 digit of n is a base 9 digit of n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: bQ[n_]:=Module[{idn8=Union[IntegerDigits[n,8]],idn9=Union[ IntegerDigits[ n,9]]},And@@ (MemberQ[ idn9,#]&/@idn8)]; Select[Range[1500],bQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 17 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List ((\\), nub)a037405 n = a037405_list !! (n-1)a037405_list = filter f [1..] where   f x = null $ nub (ds 8 x) \\ nub (ds 9 x)   ds b x = if x > 0 then d : ds b x' else []  where (x', d) = divMod x b-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 30 2013
author: _Clark Kimberling_
